steps.title: Express both sides with base 3
steps.content: The equation is 3^(x-8) = (1/27)^x. Since 27 = 3^3, we have 1/27 = 3^(-3). Therefore, the right side becomes (3^(-3))^x = 3^(-3x).

steps.title: Set exponents equal and solve for x
steps.content: Now we have 3^(x-8) = 3^(-3x). Since the bases are equal (both are 3), we can set the exponents equal: x - 8 = -3x. Adding 3x to both sides: 4x - 8 = 0. Adding 8 to both sides: 4x = 8. Dividing by 4: x = 2.

steps.title: Verify the solution
steps.content: Check: Left side = 3^(2-8) = 3^(-6) = 1/729. Right side = (1/27)^2 = 1/729. Both sides are equal, confirming x = 2.
